input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: EPFL - PURCHASING DEPARTMENT. Summary: Asb@Epfl Construction Site Insurance. Description: To meet needs in the field of fundamental research, EPFL is launching the construction of the new Advanced Science Building (ASB). This building will be able to isolate any external disturbance thanks to a central silo mounted on springs. Variations in temperature, hydrometry, noise, vibration and electromagnetic fields will be reduced as much as possible. This project requires the conclusion of construction works and civil liability insurance for the client and civil liability of project participants. Bidders will be required to undertake the following tasks: · Submit a site offer bringing together the risks of construction work and civil liability of the Project Owner and insurance excess civil liability for all project participants; · Provide a designated person for contractual management and claims management; · The bidder must submit his insurance offer provided for under the form of an exact draft policy or a draft contract ready for signature with the corresponding general insurance conditions (CGA), additional conditions and special conditions. The main contractual clauses must in particular be reformulated correctly so that they can be clearly evaluated. Legally valid signatures must be affixed to these documents. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SWISS FEDERAL RAILWAYS SBB PASSENGER SERVICES PRODUCTION. Summary: Procurement Project for 'High-Speed Trains' - Operating Lease. Description: SBB AG aims to procure up to 40 multi-current high-speed trains for international passenger services under an operating lease in accordance with the definition of finance leasing as stipulated in Swiss GAAP FER 13 ‘Leases-. The vehicles are to be used in Switzerland, France, Italy, Spain, England (London), Belgium and the Netherlands. This invitation to tender contains the required lease agreement with a basic term of 15 years. In addition, the procurement includes options as detailed below. In parallel with the invitation to tender for the operating lease agreement, SBB AG will be conducting an invitation to tender for a purchase agreement for up to 40 vehicles in the basic order quantity and a service agreement for their maintenance over a period of 15 years. This procedure is scheduled to begin in the second quarter of 2026. Following the award of the contract to the rolling stock manufacturer, the purchase agreement for the basic order quantity of up to 40 vehicles is intended to be transferred to the lessor. All option rights and the maintenance service agreement will remain with SBB AG and will not be transferred to the lessor. <br> Doc Title: Procurement Project for 'High-Speed Trains' - Operating Lease <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-08-28. Closing Date: 2025-09-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: SWISS FEDERAL RAILWAYS SBB PASSENGER SERVICES PRODUCTION
